prop.head.headtext: Handling Cases Before the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation

prop.head.label.name: Chapter
prop.head.headtext: Effect of Transfer: Proceedings in the Transferee Court

head.headtext: Disposition in the transferee court—Transfer of case to transferee court for trial

para.paratext: Although the language of the statute, as interpreted in Lexecon, prevents the transferee judge from transferring MDL cases to himself or herself for trial, there is no impediment to a transferor court, upon remand by the Panel, from transferring cases under § 1404(a). This transfer could be to the MDL transferee court, or to any other court, but this mechanism would only be available for actions that could have been brought initially in the transferee district. Additionally, the criteria for transfer under § 1404(a) do not include “familiarity of the transferee judge with the actions,” and the transfer should be appropriate under the § 1404(a) criteria without regard to the transferee judge's MDL experience.
Maslon Edelman Borman & Brand, LLP, Minneapolis, Minnesota.
